#summary SCP+

= SCP+ =

*Status: Planning; some unstable Beta code ...*

SCP+ is a package of extensions for SCP, written in Python.
Additionally provides the following functions:

 * *--(un)pack*: compress content before transfer, unpack on the remote machine
 * *--continue* an interrupted transfer
 * *--hash*: compare files after transfer (by MD5 hash)
 * *--direct*: tell host1 to directly transfer to host2
 * *smv*: secure move = delete files after secure copying


= scp+ =
{{{
 $ scp -C ...
}}}

== --pack ==
 # source exists?
 # yes: tar --update --remove-files
 # no: tar --create --remove-files


== --unpack ==
 * unpack after transfer
 * remove tar if successfull


== --continue ==
 # list local files
 # list remote files
 # list conflicting files
 # if host2 file > host1 file: error
 # elif equal: md5sum & compare
 # elif host2 file < host1 file: dd if=host2 bs=host1 size count=1 | md5sum & compare
 # transfer remaining & concatenate ...
 # transfer unique files


== --pack AND --continue ==
 # if host2 tar file > host1 tar file: error
 # elif equal: md5sum & compare
 # elif host2 file < host1 file: dd if=host2 bs=host1 size count=1 | md5sum & compare
 # transfer remaining & concatenate ...


== --hash ==

 # list all files
 # run host1 md5sum files
 # run host2 md5sum files
 # print list
 # if additionally _--move_ argument is provided to scp.py (as done by smv.py), delete equal files


= smv =
{{{
 $ scp+ --pack --unpack --continue --hash --remove-equal ...
}}}
